intro: Hypochaeris alliatae, commonly known as the garlic hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm and features alternate, hairy leaves that are lance-shaped. Its flowers are yellow and bloom from late spring to early summer, attracting various pollinators. Hypochaeris alliatae is often found in disturbed soils and can be invasive in some regions.
